title: nusxi
author: nusxi
content: Hello! I'm interested in purchasing USDT (Tether) for cash or bitcoins. I currently live in Dubai and would like to acquire a stable cryptocurrency for future use. If you have the ability to offer me USDT in exchange for cash or bitcoins, please let me know. I'm open to discussing the details of the transaction, including terms, exchange rate, and a convenient meeting place for both of us. Additionally, I'm willing to offer an additional 2% in your favor as an incentive. Please contact me at @hodlmuhammed to discuss further details. I'm ready to proceed with the transaction as soon as possible.

comments.author: jessica.roy
comments.body: Have you explored Pallapay or Cryptodesk in Dubai's downtown area? It appears that they provide in-person services at their office location.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Use p2p exchanges that do not require KYC verification. They will help you get the best deals and also you won't have headache lookin gfor an escrow service because the exchange itself is an escrow service.1. https://agoradesk.com2. https://localcoinswap.com3. https://hodlhodl.com4. https://bisq.network5. https://exch.cx (no cash option)

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: I live there. Are you a resident or a tourist? If you have a bank account in a Gulf bank, you can use ----> https://www.rain.com/ They have a license from the Kingdom of Bahrain, and you can link your bank account and buy a group of cryptocurrencies at prices better than 2% .If you do not have a bank account or want to trade in cash, you can search on Binance P2P, you will find some interested people in Dubai's downtown area.In general, it is easy to find traders if you want to buy or sell at a rate greater than 2%, but be careful of trades of more than 10K dirhams, as sometimes it may cause you legal problems.

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: I am not sure why this sounds bit odd for me. But you probably haven't heard that Binance has got their office there, and they're the first exchange to receive a license from the government there. Anyway, you'll be required to have some verification though and if that's what you're trying to avoid, might try the suggestions above. And it seems like you like a meet up trade but I don't think that many are going to like that setup if you can do that online, and for their personal reasons like safety although Dubai don't have that much of a problem AFAIK.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: tabas on September 05, 2023, 11:15:05 AMI am not sure why this sounds bit odd for me. But you probably haven't heard that Binance has got their office there, and they're the first exchange to receive a license from the government there. It is true that Binance has a 'Preparatory MVP' crypto license in Dubai, but after the bankruptcy of FTX, things changed a bit and the authorities became more stringent[1], just as if you do not have a bank account in a Gulf bank, you have no choice than P2P.It is true that trading may not sound familiar, but it is good for those who do not want a lot of legal complications or why this money was transferred from your account. The shortest and best solution is ----> https://www.rain.com/[1] https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-04-05/dubai-asks-binance-other-crypto-license-applicants-for-more-information#xj4y7vzkg

comments.author: tabas
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on September 06, 2023, 11:27:47 AMQuote from: tabas on September 05, 2023, 11:15:05 AMI am not sure why this sounds bit odd for me. But you probably haven't heard that Binance has got their office there, and they're the first exchange to receive a license from the government there. It is true that Binance has a 'Preparatory MVP' crypto license in Dubai, but after the bankruptcy of FTX, things changed a bit and the authorities became more stringent[1], just as if you do not have a bank account in a Gulf bank, you have no choice than P2P.It is true that trading may not sound familiar, but it is good for those who do not want a lot of legal complications or why this money was transferred from your account. The shortest and best solution is ----> https://www.rain.com/[1] https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2023-04-05/dubai-asks-binance-other-crypto-license-applicants-for-more-information#xj4y7vzkgOh, so that's possible after taking some approval and even got the first license. It should have been called like the first step/phase of owning a license there for exchanges. I guess Dubai is just being too careful on this one and wanting to make sure that their citizens will be in Binance's hand so they're taking more security measures and steps for asking more from Binance. And rain seems to be really the best as per checking it, hopefully OP could give some feed back.

comments.author: Bitcoinpoly
comments.body: You can easily do that by swapping Bitcoin to USDT, download Bitget and send your Btc there, then you can swap it into USDT, a friend of mine used it and equally confirmed to me that Bitcoins get delivered to wallet very fast on Bitget unlike other exchanges especially when sending through PayPal.

comments.author: Gladitorcomeback
comments.body: Quote from: nusxi on September 04, 2023, 12:59:24 PMHello! I'm interested in purchasing USDT (Tether) for cash or bitcoins. I currently live in Dubai and would like to acquire a stable cryptocurrency for future use. If you have the ability to offer me USDT in exchange for cash or bitcoins, please let me know. I'm open to discussing the details of the transaction, including terms, exchange rate, and a convenient meeting place for both of us. Additionally, I'm willing to offer an additional 2% in your favor as an incentive. Please contact me at @hodlmuhammed to discuss further details. I'm ready to proceed with the transaction as soon as possible.If you have already bitcoins then you can easily exchange for usdt. The exchanged mentioned by Bitcoin_Arena are the top ones and I think you should use one of them because you need no kyc in these exchanges and all these exchanges are trust worthy so far. besides these I will also recommend to check non kyc exchanges Thread created by Ratimov and you will find many exchange with fee and minimum withdraw detail etcQuote from: Bitcoinpoly on September 09, 2023, 03:14:53 AMYou can easily do that by swapping Bitcoin to USDT, download Bitget and send your Btc there, then you can swap it into USDT, a friend of mine used it and equally confirmed to me that Bitcoins get delivered to wallet very fast on Bitget unlike other exchanges especially when sending through PayPal. Bitget support buying usdt through Paypal without KYC? I used Bitget and recieved withdraw very fast but we should not take risk in new exchange. Binance is i think best option as already got licence these in UAE

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoinpoly on September 12, 2023, 03:09:42 AMBitget is equally licensed to operate in UAE, I’m sure it’s a good exchange to use couple with their swiftness.  This is not true. Please stop spamming the forum using Bitget. I searched your account and the last 20 replies contained the word Bitget in more than 10 different topics.Bitget has opened an office in downtown Dubai and plans to hire employees and explore a way to obtain a license, but there is no news about them obtaining a license, and all that is being talked about are plans and there are no clear confirmations.For citizens in the Emirates, their best option is still what I mentioned above or peer-to-peer trading (I do not recommend it for amounts larger than 10,000 dirhams or 3,000 dollars).https://www.coindesk.com/business/2023/07/20/crypto-exchange-bitget-opens-dubai-office-plans-middle-east-expansion/QuoteBitget said it has started recruiting for the new roles, with several members of staff already hired for middle- and back-office positions.“We hope to scale our Middle Eastern team rapidly to support business growth, with between 30 to 60 hires over the next two years,” Gracy Chen, managing director, said in a statement.The company has already started exploring license applications in order to operate in Middle Eastern markets. The expansion follows Biget’s launch in Turkey earlier this year.

comments.author: BitSwapNow
comments.body: BitSwapNow.com offers 850+ crypto pairs for instant cross-chain swaps as well as buying and selling for a wide range of fiat currencies. No sign-up is required and you can start swapping instantly. I thought this might help as we are safe, reputable and a quick working non-custodial exchange.

comments.author: CCMS
comments.body: I think there are way too many exchanges for this .
